alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fentress; Jackson; Overton; Pickett (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 8:18AM CDT until July 20 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Clay County in middle Tennessee... Northwestern Fentress County in middle Tennessee... Northeastern Jackson County in middle Tennessee... Northern Overton County in middle Tennessee... Western Pickett County in middle Tennessee... * Until 1130 AM CDT. * At 818 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen with additional rainfall expected. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Livingston, Celina, Byrdstown, Standing Stone State Park, Dale Hollow Lake and Moss. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
